com.oracle.tools.runtime
Class AbstractApplication<A>

java.lang.Object
  com.oracle.tools.runtime.AbstractApplication<A>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Application<A>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractJavaApplication, SimpleApplication
public abstract class AbstractApplication<A>
extends Object
implements Application<A>

An AbstractApplication is a base implementation for an Application that interally uses a Process as a means of representing and controlling the said Application, typically at the operating system level.

Copyright (c) 2011. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

Author:
Brian Oliver, Harvey Raja

Parameters:
process - the Process representing the Application
name - the name of the application
console - the ApplicationConsole that will be used for I/O by the Application
environmentVariables - the environment variables used when establishing the Application

destroy

public int destroy()
Terminates and destroys the running Application. Upon returning from this method you can safely assume the Application is no longer running.

Specified by:
destroy in interface Application<A>
Returns:
the exit value of the Application (by convention 0 indicates normal termination)

waitFor

public int waitFor()
            throws InterruptedException
Causes the calling Thread to block and wait until the Application has terminated, either naturally or due to a call to Application.destroy() by another Thread.

This method returns immediately if the Application has already been terminated.

Specified by:
waitFor in interface Application<A>
Returns:
the exit value of the Application (by convention 0 indicates normal termination)
Throws:
InterruptedException - if the calling Thread is interrupted by another thread while it is waiting.

exitValue

Obtains the exit value for the terminated Application.

Specified by:
exitValue in interface Application<A>
Returns:
the exit value of the Application
